<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The helper class to build type name based on DIE properties.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It builds synthetic name based on explicit attributes: DW&#95;AT&#95;name,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// DW&#95;AT&#95;linkage&#95;name or based on implicit attributes(DW&#95;AT&#95;decl&#42;).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Names for specific DIEs(like subprograms, template classes...) include</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// additional attributes: subprogram parameters, template parameters,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// array ranges. Examples of built name:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class A &#123;  &#125;                    : &#123;8&#125;A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// namspace llvm &#123; class A &#123;  &#125; &#125;  : &#123;1&#125;llvm&#123;8&#125;A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// template &lt;int&gt; structure B &#123; &#125;  : &#123;F&#125;B&lt;&#123;0&#125;int&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// void foo ( int p1, float p3 )   : &#123;a&#125;void foo(&#123;0&#125;int, &#123;0&#125;int)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// int &#42;ptr;                       : &#123;c&#125;ptr &#123;0&#125;int</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// int var;                        : &#123;d&#125;var</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// These names is used to refer DIEs describing types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#ae3ed13db9bc68f498cef6781d0c56f76">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Analyze \\p InputUnitEntryPair for the type name and possibly assign</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// built type name to the DIE&#39;s type info.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// NOTE: while analyzing types we may create different kind of names</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// for the same type depending on whether the type is part of another type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// f.e. DW&#95;TAG&#95;formal&#95;parameter would receive &quot;&#123;02&#125;01&quot; name when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// examined alone. Or &quot;&#123;0&#125;int&quot; name when it is a part of a function name:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#123;a&#125;void foo(&#123;0&#125;int). The \\p AssignNameToTypeDescriptor tells whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the type name is part of another type name and then should not be assigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to DIE type descriptor.</span></CodeLine>
